author: Diana Beas
title: Regresa Mexicana de Aviaci√≥n a Puerto Vallarta
text:
PUERTO VALLARTA, Jal., 23 de enero de 2025.- La aerol√≠nea Mexicana de Aviaci√≥n dio a conocer este jueves su regreso a Puerto Vallarta, esto, luego de que a principios de mes anunci√≥ la cancelaci√≥n de varios vuelos en al menos ocho destinos del pa√≠s.
El director de la aerol√≠nea, capit√°n Jos√© Su√°rez, dio a conocer que la aerol√≠nea regresa a varios destinos y suma otros vuelos m√°s.
El anuncio se dio durante la conferencia matutina de la presidenta Claudia Sheinbaum Pardo, donde el capit√°n Su√°rez anunci√≥ la ampliaci√≥n de dos destinos m√°s Monterrey y Puerto Vallarta para sumar 14 en todo el pa√≠s.
¬´Con esta renovaci√≥n que tenemos en el primer trimestre, o sea, a partir de enero febrero estamos nosotros considerando ampliar dos destinos m√°s para sumar 12 destinos, igualmente a partir del segundo trimestre, ampliaremos dos destinos m√°s se estar√≠a sumando Monterrey y Puerto Vallarta, para sumar 14 destinos a los cuales Mexicana estar√° volando durante este 2025¬ª, expres√≥.
El director de la aerol√≠nea inform√≥ tambi√©n que, con una proyecci√≥n de m√°s de 500 mil pasajeros, estar√°n ofreciendo unos productos de conectividad de m√°s de 83 conexiones, ¬´a trav√©s del Aeropuerto Internacional Felipe √Ångeles donde es nuestra base principal de operaciones¬ª, expres√≥.
Fue durante el pasado Gobierno Federal que se llev√≥ a cabo el rescate de la aerol√≠nea, la cual estuvo por varios a√±os fuera del aire tras su declaraci√≥n de quiebre en 2010.

author: Not the Bee
title: United Church of Christ "pastor" says she doesn't know if Jesus rose from the dead: "It doesn't change a thing" ü•¥
text:
It feels like we've got an epidemic of "pastors" who have never once cracked open a Bible and who have most certainly never read an epistle from the Apostle Paul.
The latest example is this United Church of Christ "minister" from LA who thinks the resurrection may or may not have happened. But, honestly, she doesn't care.
Well, do I think that it (the resurrection) could have happened and did happen? I believe so ... I feel it probably did.
Okay, great! Stop right there. Don't say another word. Drop the "probably" and move on, you're doing okay!
But no, she continues.
But if I'm to be scientific or realistic I don't know. And I say that because there's no 'proof,' there's no 'proof.'
Did it really happen? ... Did Jesus really raise from the dead? I don't know.
This is where CS Lewis would insert a "Your Affectionate Uncle, Screwtape."
To make matters (somehow) worse, she decided to double down.
If Jesus didn't physically raise from the dead and ascend, it doesn't change a thing about my love of God and Christ and Christianity ... because I truly believe in my heart of hearts that my faith is a resurrection faith ... come to Easter service and hear a heretical sermon!
Well, she got that last part right!
Jesus' ressureaction doesn't matter to you? It wouldn't change your faith?
What did the Apostle Paul have to say about that?
I Corinthians 15:14-17
'And if Christ is not risen, then our preaching is empty and your faith is also empty. Yes, and we are found false witnesses of God, because we have testified of God that He raised up Christ, whom He did not raise up ‚Äî if in fact the dead do not rise. For if the dead do not rise, then Christ is not risen. And if Christ is not risen, your faith is futile; you are still in your sins!'
Read the Bible, Reverend Pat!
P.S. Now check out our latest video üëá
Keep up with our latest videos ‚Äî Subscribe to our YouTube channel!

author: Deanna Csomo Ferrell
title: Annual Christmas Lecture to feature engaging science TV show host, podcaster, and NASA communicator Michelle Thaller
text:
Michelle Thaller, former assistant director for science communication at NASA‚Äôs Goddard Space Flight Center, will unveil how we can use infrared energy to see ‚Äúhidden light‚Äù of the universe during the fourth annual Christmas Lecture on Friday, Dec. 6 at South Bend‚Äôs Century Center.
Her talk, ‚ÄúThe Hidden Reality: Exploring the Invisible Universe with the James Webb Telescope,‚Äù will engage the young and old alike. This marks the first time the Christmas Lecture is presented outside the Notre Dame campus, and will begin at 6:30 p.m. after the tree lighting during Downtown South Bend‚Äôs (DTSB) holiday celebration. The Century Center is located at 120 Martin Luther King Jr. Boulevard.
Thaller, who holds a doctorate in astrophysics, said she loves science, but enjoys it most when she can describe it within a story. Being a science ‚Äúwhiz‚Äù isn‚Äôt a requirement for anyone wanting to get into the field.
‚ÄúI actually didn‚Äôt do particularly well in my science classes,‚Äù said Thaller, who earned her undergraduate degree in astrophysics from Harvard University. ‚ÄúIf I can‚Äôt put a piece of knowledge into a narrative structure, it kind of slips out of my mind.‚Äù
She has made science storytelling central to her career. In addition to her role at NASA, Thaller hosted Discovery Science Channel‚Äôs How the Universe Works from 2007-2015 and the podcast Orbital Path from 2015 to 2018. For NASA she worked with scientists on how to appropriately describe their work to many different audiences, and helped others write for the non-scientist crowd.
During her interactive, high-energy talk, Thaller ‚Äî who hosted the release of NASA‚Äôs first images from the James Webb Space Telescope ‚Äî will share some of the beautiful images from that instrument. She will also demonstrate how infrared instruments help astronomers ‚Äúsee‚Äù into the depths of the Universe.
She enjoys working with middle school children, and fully remembers her sense of awe and wonder when she watched Carl Sagan‚Äôs Cosmos series by age 10.
‚ÄúCarl Sagan‚Äôs show was all about stories,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúScience wasn‚Äôt just standalone knowledge. It was these wonderful narratives about discovery, from how stars were made to what Einstein was doing as a teenager.‚Äù
This love for storytelling shaped her approach to science communication, leading her to emphasize the human side of astronomy. ‚ÄúThe personalities in astronomy ‚Äî Albert Einstein, Cecilia Payne, and countless others ‚Äî have incredible stories,‚Äù she said, highlighting Payne‚Äôs pivotal discovery that stars are made of hydrogen.
Thaller likes to stress to her younger audience members that it takes a variety of different approaches to learning in order to be a scientist. Girls, especially, may feel or be told that they aren‚Äôt ‚Äúgood‚Äù at math, and that can be damaging.
After earning her bachelor‚Äôs degree in astrophysics from Harvard University, she completed her doctoral degree at Georgia State University. She once earned a D in a course on differential equations, but became competent by continuing to work at it.
Thaler also learned that because her brain works a little differently than some of her colleagues, people turn to her to solve different types of problems.
‚ÄúI put together unrelated ideas better than I think a lot of my colleagues do,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThey would come to me and say they‚Äôre writing this proposal, and we need to bring in these different ideas and we‚Äôre not sure how to link them, and I was able to show them how there‚Äôs a story here and that one part leads to another."
She landed her job at NASA in a circuitous way. A specialist in massive stars in binary systems ‚Äî systems in which two objects orbit around a common center of mass ‚Äî she sometimes studied stars in the southern sky, which led her to telescopes in Australia and South America.
In Australia, she met and fell in love with another astronomer, who would become her future husband, and ‚Äúhe and I were trying to figure out how to be on the same continent,‚Äù she said. After her postdoctoral research fellowship at the University of Montreal, both astronomers were offered jobs at NASA‚Äôs Jet Propulsion Laboratory at the California Institute of Technology. She began in the infrared astronomy group‚Äôs public outreach program, and soon realized that communicating about astrophysics was the job she was meant to have.
Thaller, who has started a new job as an adjunct professor at the University of Wisconsin at Madison, is looking forward to sharing all the amazing sights that the James Webb telescope can ‚Äúsee.‚Äù
‚ÄúWhen I was a practicing research astronomer, things that we sort of surmised were going on, with stars being born and dying, are something we can see with the James Webb,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI never thought I‚Äôd actually literally see them!‚Äù
Modeled after the Royal Institution‚Äôs Christmas Lecture series, the Christmas Lecture aims to inspire general audiences with the curiosity and wonder of scientific inquiry. Her talk will be accompanied by specialty cookies, a hot chocolate bar, and will be followed by a Q+A between her and Kate Biberdorf, aka Kate the Chemist, who gave the 2023 Christmas Lecture. Guests will want to stay for the entire event, because there‚Äôs a special surprise at the end!
Originally published by science.nd.edu on November 21, 2024.

author: Chris Dawson
title: All ages celebrate TD Tree Days - North Bay News
text: Trees for Nipissing continues to plant trees in the North Bay area. On September 14th a group of volunteers from various local TD branches took part in TD Tree Days. It's the fourth year for the initiative which was held at the Marsh Drive landfill site. Close to 30 volunteers worked for 2.5 hours as they planted 400 trees. Peggy Walsh Craig, Chair of Trees for Nipissing, says its an important event that many of the volunteers look forward to. "The reason we're doing this at the former landfill is because that site is eroding into Chippewa Creek, and people are using that land with their ATVs and snowmobiles,," said Walsh Craig. "That's okay, but they make so many new trails all the time that contributes to the erosion. So we don't mind that they use that land, but we would like it to be a little bit less trailed up, as you might say, so we can work at restoring the land to the forest that it once was." Walsh Craig says they planted all native species of trees and had all ages of people participating. "There was, I think the youngest was two and a half, and the oldest was in late 70s. And the TD Tree Days, the organization is always very impressed with how many trees we get in the ground for the number of volunteers that we have." This is one of a handful of Trees for Nipissing tree planting events the group is coordinating this fall. In the end, these initiatives aim to restore land and create lasting memories for volunteers

author: By
title: Firefighter on snowplowing route notices house fire, rescues 4 people and 3 dogs
text:
TRUMBULL, Conn. (WFSB/Gray News) - A firefighter who was plowing the snowy streets of Trumbull, Connecticut, jumped into action to rescue four people and three dogs when he happened upon a house fire.
WFSB reports Shaun Bogen‚Äôs quick actions were credited with saving the lives of the victims.
The Long Hill Fire Department said the house fire on Haviland Drive began just before 4 a.m. Sunday.
While he was on the plowing route, Bogen discovered a house with a fire in the garage, according to the fire department. Bogen radioed into his base to alert them of the fire and called 911.
Bogen then sprung into action, waking up the four sleeping residents and their three dogs and making sure everyone was outside before the fire department arrived.
A total of 26 firefighters responded to the fire, and the first unit to arrive found the fire most heavy in the garage and extending into the home.
The firefighters brought the fire under control in less than one hour.
Officials said there did not appear to be any injuries.
The cause of the fire remains under investigation.
Copyright 2024 WFSB via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: Sagarika Gautam
title: Salaar, starring Prabhas, earns Rs 500 crore worldwide - The Daily Guardian
text: ‚ÄúSalaar: Part 1-Ceasefire,‚Äù starring Prabhas and Prithviraj Sukumaran, is breaking records at the box office and broke through the Rs 500 crore mark globally. Prithviraj Sukumaran posted a poster on Instagram along with an updated report on the box office receipts. Sharing the poster, he wrote, ‚Äú#SalaarCeaseFire has crossed a massive Rs 500 CRORES at the worldwide box office (GBOC)#SalaarCeaseFireHits500Crs.‚Äù As soon as the news was shared, fans and followers chimed in the comment section. One of the users wrote, ‚ÄúUff.‚Äù Another user commented, ‚ÄúWhat a film.‚Äù Helmed by ‚ÄòKGF 2‚Äô director Prashanth Neel, ‚ÄòSalaar: Part 1- Ceasefire‚Äô stars Prabhas, Prithviraj Sukumaran, and Shruti Haasan in the lead roles. ‚ÄòSalaar: Part 1-Ceasefire‚Äô also stars Tinnu Anand and Jagapathi Babu in pivotal roles. The movie also marks the biggest collaboration between KGF director Prashanth Neel and ‚ÄòBaahubali‚Äô star Prabhas, who are coming together for the first time to create the mega action-packed cinematic spectacle.

author: @Le360
title: Dans la province de Taroudant, les premi√®res aides directes accueillies avec satisfaction par les b√©n√©ficiaires | le360.ma
text:
Nous sommes √† Ighri, une commune rurale de la province de Taroudant o√π, comme dans d‚Äôautres contr√©es du Maroc, des m√©nages d√©valoris√©s ont commenc√© √† recevoir le premier versement des aides sociales directes. Octroy√©es √† une p√©riodicit√© mensuelle √† des familles en situation de fragilit√© ou ayant des enfants en √¢ge de scolarit√©, et ne b√©n√©ficient actuellement d‚Äôaucune assistance sociale familiale, ces aides ont pour but de soutenir leur pouvoir d‚Äôachat, d‚Äôam√©liorer leurs conditions de vie et leur offrir un filet de protection sociale.
Dans cette localit√©, Le360 a recueilli des d√©clarations et impressions de certains b√©n√©ficiaires. Brahim Sellak, est l‚Äôun d‚Äôeux, forgeron de m√©tier, mari√© et p√®re de trois enfants. Heureux d‚Äôavoir pu recevoir cette aide bienvenue, l‚Äôhomme nous explique son parcours pour atteindre √† ce r√©sultat. ¬´ Nous avons d‚Äôabord effectu√© l‚Äôenregistrement, moi et ma femme, ainsi que nos enfants, au ca√Ødat. Nous nous sommes enregistr√©s ensuite sur le site Internet ¬ª, d√©taille-t-il.
¬´ Alhamdoulillah (louange √† dieu), nous sommes parmi les premiers dans le douar √† recevoir cette aide. J‚Äôai per√ßu 600 dirhams. Cela peut servir √† payer la facture d‚Äôeau et d‚Äô√©lectricit√©, et acheter un sac de farine. Ce n‚Äôest pas rien ¬ª, poursuit-il.
Lire aussi : Aide sociale directe: √† Jerada, forte affluence dans les bureaux administratifs pour s‚Äôinscrire au programme
M√™me son de cloche aupr√®s de Za√Øna Boukharouach, octog√©naire √©nergique √† la fr√™le silhouette √©cras√©e par le poids des ans, mais √† la bonne humeur contagieuse. ¬´ J‚Äôai re√ßu 500 DH. Cet argent m‚Äôa √©t√© tr√®s utile. J‚Äôai pay√© la facture d‚Äôeau et d‚Äô√©lectricit√© et j‚Äôai achet√© des l√©gumes. Il me reste encore 300 DH. Cela peut servir √† acheter de la farine, du savon, un peu de viande et de l√©gumes, ainsi qu‚Äôune bonbonne de gaz et des v√™tements ¬ª, √©num√®re-t-elle avec un enthousiasme palpable.
Par M'hand Oubarka Le 07/01/2024 √† 18h32

author: Aaron Curtis
title: 'I was not expecting this': Lowell Police unions replace teen's stolen e-bike
text: LOWELL ‚Äî The situation might have looked a bit bleak recently for Lowell High student Nam Phan. But in the end, members of the Lowell Police Department came together to show Phan that good things do happen to good people. The discouraging incident occurred on Oct. 14. Phan had spent that Saturday afternoon helping out with a much-needed trash cleanup in Downtown Lowell. When the sophomore wrapped up for the day, he returned to the spot where he locked up his electric bike only to find it was gone. Stolen. An electric bike, or e-bike, is a bicycle equipped with a motor to assist the operator as they pedal. The motor receives its power from a rechargeable battery. The bikes tend to cost hundreds of dollars. Left with the broken remains of his bike lock, Phan assumed he was out of an expensive e-bike, which he used regularly as a primary means of getting to school, work, wrestling practice and home. ‚ÄúI was so angry because that day I had to walk home,‚Äù Phan said in a press release about the incident. Police said City Manager Tom Golden‚Äôs office received word of Phan‚Äôs stolen bike, and reached out to the Lowell Police Officer‚Äôs Union and the Lowell Police Superior Officer‚Äôs Union. After hearing the upsetting news, the unions, led by Lt. Aidan O‚ÄôDonnell and Officer Timothy Roussell, decided to use union funds to buy Phan a new bike of the exact make and model that was stolen. Roussell said it was an easy decision, pointing out youth like Nam, who is in the ROTC at Lowell High, ‚Äúare an asset to our community.‚Äù ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs displayed a good attitude and a positive work ethic, and he was giving back to the community when he had something bad happen to him,‚Äù Roussell said. ‚ÄúWe felt it was important to show him that good things happen to good people.‚Äù On Dec. 19, school resource officers from Lowell High escorted Phan to Lowell Police headquarters on Arcand Drive, where the sophomore was presented with the new bike ‚Äî an Ancheer electric bike. Phan was also thanked for his work helping clean up the city. ‚ÄúThe men and women of Lowell Police Department invest in the City‚Äôs youth on a regular basis, so when City Manager Golden‚Äôs office reached out to tell us about this young man‚Äôs e-bike being stolen while he was volunteering his time to clean up his city, it was a no-brainer,‚Äù O‚ÄôDonnell said in the release. Phan expressed gratitude for the new bike, adding, ‚ÄúI was not expecting this.‚Äù ‚ÄúBut these guys came out and did all this for me and I‚Äôm really grateful,‚Äù Phan said. Follow Aaron Curtis on X, formerly known as Twitter, @aselahcurtis

author: zelt
title: #21 Las Urgencias en Madrid, al borde del colapso: resisten con 1.000 camas menos en plena escalada de gripe y covid

Pues me suena a masoquismo

Estoy seguro que muchos de los que vais deseando poco menos que la muerte a los madrile√±os tambi√©n ten√©is la desgracia de tener gobiernos del PP o PP+ Vox pero est√° claro que la madrile√±ofobia sube el karma
Por cierto efectivamente la sanidad en Madrid es una puta mierda y las urgencias una locura

A si tienes razaon el nivel de estos periodicos iguala a libertad digital o el ABC pero estos no llegan todos los dias a portada
